title: bug: Prompting OpenAI Responses with message history fails due to wrong enum variant conversion
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Bug Report
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
--->
Prompting OpenAI's Responses API fails when used with message history due to it being converted to the wrong enum variant (`OutputMessage` vs. `Message`).

A PR will be opened shortly!

edit: OK this seemed a bit more tricky than before. The ID field as an input is technically not required, but if you put one in it needs to be in the OpenAI format.

title: feat: yield `R` from `StreamingCompletionResponse<R>` as item in `Stream` trait impl

type.name: Feat
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Feature Request
<!--
High level description of the requested feature or improvement.
-->
There is a small correction to be made in the `StreamingCompletionResponse<R>` Stream impl in that we never actually yield the final response (`R`).  

This is slightly problematic as it means we will never get the final result which means that when compiling to other languages, we may struggle with being able to provide the usage metrics for the stream.

See the following example. In this stream, it will only ever map over types of `rig::completion::ToolAssistant`. This stream then gets turned into a `wasm_streams::ReadableStream` which means theoretically we can never return the usage metrics back to the user.

While this is technically not a big deal in Rust, returning the final item is unreachable in JavaScript for example). You can see the stream below where the item captured in `.map_ok()` is of type `rig::completion::AssistantContent`.
```rust
        let stream =
            self.0.stream_prompt(prompt).await.map_err(|x| {
                JsError::new(format!("Error while streaming response: {x}").as_ref())
            })?;

        let js_stream = stream
            .map_ok(|x| {
                serde_wasm_bindgen::to_value(&x)
                    .map_err(|e| JsValue::from_str(&format!("Failed streaming: {e}")))
            })
            .map(|result| match result {
                Ok(Ok(js)) => Ok(js),
                Ok(Err(js_err)) => Err(js_err),
                Err(e) => Err(JsValue::from_str(&format!("Stream error: {e}"))),
            });
```

### Motivation
<!--
Please describe the use case(s) or other motivation for the new feature.
-->
Better DX and usage metrics from streaming

### Proposal
<!--
How should the new feature be implemented, and why? Add any considered
drawbacks.
-->
Implement a new streaming enum type, `StreamingContentAssistant`, which basically wraps the original `AssistantContent` and then additionally has another enum arm for the final response.

### Alternatives
<!--
Are there other ways to solve this problem that you've considered? What are
their potential drawbacks? Why was the proposed solution chosen over these
alternatives?
-->
Not doing it. But then I guess we'll be lacking this feature in the JS port.

title: feat: extended details from prompting
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Feature Request
Add the ability to gather used tokens and other per-prompt details from `.prompt` via the `PromptBuilder`.

### Motivation
While `.completion` provides the full completion request, it's still fairly useful to do some accounting with the higher level API, especially considering the amount of potential tokens being used via multi-turn. This would allow looping to accumulate tokens usage and present them seamlessly to the user w/o much api hassle.

### Proposal
```rs
agent
  .prompt(...)
  .extended_details()  // or some better name
```

Add a boolean (or type-state) to `PromptBuilder`. Come up with an `PromptResponse` that accumulates tokens used and other useful details about the raw responses made.

### Alternatives
Separate method alongside `.completion`.

title: Update MCP feature to use official SDK
body:
### Description

* Rig currently uses an outdated MCP library
* Change the Rig MCP integration to use the [official Rust SDK](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/rust-sdk)
  * Note: the version of the official SDK that is published on crates.io is very outdated and does not support things like the Streamable HTTP transport. Consider using the git main branch of specific commit hash instead

title: feat: DynClientBuilder::from_values
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Feature Request
A method to be able to load runtime api keys into `DynClientBuilder`

### Motivation
Atm, when using any of the `DynClientBuilder` tech from #440, it requires u to load all api keys from the environment. This is restrictive in situations where api keys are defined at runtime making it fairly tricky to use (even when doing cursed stuff like setting env vars are runtime is unsafe).

### Proposal
Likely will require some alternative to the client's `from_env_boxed` methods. something like `from_values_boxed`, etc.

### Alternatives
- None

title: bug: OpenAI Multiturn prompt streaming - Call ID not being set
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Bug Report
I'm working on getting multi-turns working with a streaming interface. I followed the example, it works with Anthropic but OpenAi will panic when it tries to feed the tool call results to openai.

## Reproduction
Take a look at my fork. I had to add the required field to all the tool definitions also.
https://github.com/ChristianPavilonis/rig/blob/multi-turn-example/rig-core/examples/multi_turn_streaming.rs

## Expected behavior
I expect it to fill the call_id in the struct and not panic.

## Additional context
Output when running `cargo run --example multi_turn_streaming`

```
     Running `./rig/target/debug/examples/multi_turn_streaming`
Response: To calculate the expression \( 2 \times (3 + 5) / 9 \), you can break it down into parts:

1. First, calculate \( (3 + 5) \) which equals \( 8 \).
2. Then, multiply that result by \( 2 \): \( 2 \times 8 = 16 \).
3. Finally, divide \( 16 \) by \( 9 \).

Now, I will use the appropriate tools to carry out these operations.To calculate the expression \( 2 \times (3 + 5) / 9 \), you can break it down into parts:

1. First, calculate \( (3 + 5) \) which equals \( 8 \).
2. Then, multiply that result by \( 2 \): \( 2 \times 8 = 16 \).
3. Finally, divide \( 16 \) by \( 9 \).

Now, I will use the appropriate tools to carry out these operations.tool_call: ToolCall { id: "fc_688038fda9c4819a8714b97be537e3c90deec1b9f23c4c10", call_id: None, function: ToolFunction { name: "add", arguments: Object {"x": Number(3), "y": Number(5)} } }
tool_result: "8"
tool_call: ToolCall { id: "fc_688038fdef10819ab2df831deea0b6f70deec1b9f23c4c10", call_id: None, function: ToolFunction { name: "multiply", arguments: Object {"x": Number(2), "y": Number(8)} } }
tool_result: "16"
tool_call: ToolCall { id: "fc_688038fe24a4819ab3a4c6a3060bc65e0deec1b9f23c4c10", call_id: None, function: ToolFunction { name: "divide", arguments: Object {"x": Number(16), "y": Number(9)} } }
tool_result: "1"

thread 'main' panicked at rig-core/src/providers/openai/responses_api/mod.rs:233:54:
The tool call ID should exist!
```

title: feat: support inserting documents as a trait
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Feature Request
<!--
High level description of the requested feature or improvement.
-->
Currently, every vector store provider integration that we have has an `insert_documents` method. It would be a great idea to formalise this as a trait. By doing so:
- We can reference this method without the compiler needing to know what type it is
- We can ensure that this behaviour is guaranteed across vector stores.

This would also be a good chance to implement a new, different type of `insert_docs` method that also takes a user-defined ID generation strategy (although perhaps out of initial scope for the first PR).

### Motivation
<!--
Please describe the use case(s) or other motivation for the new feature.
-->
Better UX, better type reusability.

### Proposal
<!--
How should the new feature be implemented, and why? Add any considered
drawbacks.
-->
Move all `insert_document` methods under a new `InsertDocuments` trait.

### Alternatives
<!--
Are there other ways to solve this problem that you've considered? What are
their potential drawbacks? Why was the proposed solution chosen over these
alternatives?
-->

bug: ollama fails to return results from multiple tools
body:
I ran into an issue where Ollama calls multiple tools, and while the logs show all tools being invoked, only one result is returned. I suspect this is due to `content.first()` dropping the other tool responses.

_Originally posted by @Benaiad in https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/pull/478#discussion_r2203265430_

title: feat: Stream cancellation
feat: support custom HTTP client configuration for proxy and advanced network settings
feat: Add ScyllaDB vector store implementation
body:
## Vector Store Integration Request
Add a new ScyllaDB vector store implementation to the Rig ecosystem.
ScyllaDB is a distributed NoSQL database compatible with Apache Cassandra. It can be deployed on-premises, in the cloud, or as a managed service. This integration would allow storing vectors alongside other data types for hybrid workloads.

### Motivation

ScyllaDB provides benefits for applications requiring both vector search and ScyllaDB's characteristics (high performance, horizontal scaling, high availability).

### Implementation

- New rig-scylladb crate following existing vector store patterns
- Application-level cosine similarity search (similar to SQLite/SurrealDB implementations)
- Compatible with Rig's VectorStoreIndex trait

### Resources
- Official Website: https://www.scylladb.com/
- Rust Driver Documentation: https://docs.rs/scylla/latest/scylla/
- Rust Driver GitHub: https://github.com/scylladb/scylla-rust-driver

title: bug: Dynamic tools lose context in multi-turn conversations
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Bug Report

Dynamic Tools lose their context during multi-turn conversations when using Agents, causing failure in complex calculations that require maintaining tool information across multiple turns.

## Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create multiple dynamic tools (e.g., add, subtract, multiply, divide)
2. Create an Agent using a vendor client model with these dynamic tools
3. Use multi-turn functionality with the prompt: "Calculate ((15 + 25) * (100 - 50)) / (200 / (10 + 10))"
4. Observe the Agent fails to complete the calculation due to lost tool context

Detailed demonstration available at:  
https://github.com/byeblack/rig-multi-turn-demo

## Expected behavior

The Agent should:
1. Maintain awareness of all dynamic tools throughout the multi-turn conversation
2. Successfully break down and compute complex nested expressions
3. Return the correct final result (200 in this case)

## Additional context
- Simple single operations work correctly
- The demo shows both the failure case and what successful behavior should look like

title: bug: Impossible to build and agent without a system prompt using certain models
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Bug Report
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
--->
Reproducible on rig-core 0.11.1
Some OpenAI models don't support messages with role System (e.g. o1-mini).
When creating an agent using such models you get an error:
```
ProviderError: {
  "error": {
    "message": "Unsupported value: 'messages[0].role' does not support 'system' with this model.",
    "type": "invalid_request_error",
    "param": "messages[0].role",
    "code": "unsupported_value"
  }
}
```
I expected that removing the preamble would fix this, but I kept getting the same error.
Looking at the code I noticed that the preamble is not an Option<String> here: https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/870f29a771d6d0c35faf211157c3cdc99124ff2c/rig-core/src/agent/completion.rs#L44
And during conversion it's populated with an empty string here:
https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/f4214540a5e90e166d17235593cd9863899c5aba/rig-core/src/agent.rs#L478

That's why eventually an empty system message will be added here:
https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/f4214540a5e90e166d17235593cd9863899c5aba/rig-core/src/providers/openai/completion.rs#L610

## Reproduction
<!--
Code snippet.
--->
Create agent using OpenAI's o1-mini model. Send a completion request.

## Expected behavior
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
--->
No system message is added to the history if no preamble is set.
## Screenshots
<!--
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
--->

## Additional context
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
--->

title: feat: gitignore .envrc
body:
`.envrc` is used by [direnv](https://direnv.net/), a program you can use to automatically set env vars upon entering a directory rather than having to spend time remembering what they are.

I'm currently pretty careful about not accidentally committing it, but needless to say we should probably gitignore it for any future contributors.

title: bug: outdated xAI completion model list
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Bug Report
The list of available models for xAI appears outdated. The only currently listed model is `GROK_BETA` associated with the identifier `"grok_beta"`, which does not appear to be a valid or available model anymore. 
"GROK_BETA" is used in multiple examples as well.
cf. [list of xAI models](https://docs.x.ai/docs/models)

## Reproduction
Attempting to use the `grok_beta` identifier with the API results in a model-not-found error. This model is no longer supported.

## Expected behavior
The model list should reflect currently available and usable model identifiers. Based on a current API query, the following models are now available and should replace or augment the current list:
```
grok-2-1212
grok-2-vision-1212
grok-3
grok-3-fast
grok-3-mini
grok-3-mini-fast
grok-2-image-1212
```

## Additional context
Ensuring the list is up-to-date would prevent users from referencing invalid models and improve compatibility with the xAI API. The naming format also suggests a versioning convention that should be monitored for future updates.

## Suggested fix
In [completion.rs](https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/cd7e7097d393bf46ae8d2bcfc796e3222250d365/rig-core/src/providers/xai/completion.rs#L17)
```rust
/// `grok-beta` completion model
// pub const GROK_BETA: &str = "grok-beta";         <- replace this line with the following:

pub const GROK_2_1212: &str = "grok-2-1212";
pub const GROK_2_VISION_1212: &str = "grok-2-vision-1212";
pub const GROK_3: &str = "grok-3";
pub const GROK_3_FAST: &str = "grok-3-fast";
pub const GROK_3_MINI: &str = "grok-3-mini";
pub const GROK_3_MINI_FAST: &str = "grok-3-mini-fast";
pub const GROK_2_IMAGE_1212: &str = "grok-2-image-1212";
```

title: feat(rig-qdrant): support upserting documents into Qdrant
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Feature Request
<!--
High level description of the requested feature or improvement.
-->
The Qdrant integration is missing a function for upserting documents which is sorely needed to avoid having to keep the lower-level client.

### Motivation
<!--
Please describe the use case(s) or other motivation for the new feature.
-->
Much better DX rather than having to use `Arc<T>` for the client and then cloning it to make the vector store.

### Proposal
<!--
How should the new feature be implemented, and why? Add any considered
drawbacks.
-->
Add a `insert_documents` function, just like the other vector stores.

### Alternatives
<!--
Are there other ways to solve this problem that you've considered? What are
their potential drawbacks? Why was the proposed solution chosen over these
alternatives?
-->
no

title: feat: Add support for HuggingFace hosted models

labels.name: model
labels.description: Relevant to new model providers or implementations

type.name: Feat
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
## Model Provider Integration Request
HuggingFace hosts many open source models (including many fine-tuned models) and provides an API to interact with them.

### Resources
Unlike many of the existing providers, the HuggingFace API has many task-specific endpoints (for instance, a text classification [endpoint](https://huggingface.co/docs/api-inference/tasks/text-classification)).

However, since Rig does not support task-specific endpoints, the integration would most likely use one of the following generic text completion endpoints:
- [chat completion](https://huggingface.co/docs/api-inference/tasks/chat-completion)
- [text completion](https://huggingface.co/docs/api-inference/tasks/text-generation)

Note: The HuggingFace API does not endpoints for generating embeddings. The integration would therefore be limited to chat completion only.

title: feat: Add support for PostgreSQL vector store

type.name: Feat
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
## Feature Request
Add vector store support for PostgreSQL (with `pg_vector` extension).

### Motivation
PostgreSQL is one of the most widely used open source databases and supports vector search via the [`pg_vector`](https://github.com/pgvector/pgvector) extension. This makes the database a good integration candidate for Rig.

### Proposal
- Create a new companion crate in the repository called `rig-postgres`.
- Implement the `VectorStore` and `VectorStoreIndex` traits for the selected PostgreSQL client.

Note: The integration should be similar to the MongoDB vector store integration (see [rig-mongodb](https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/main/rig-mongodb/src/lib.rs)).

Groq provides a high-performance inference platform optimized for large language model (LLM) workloads. Integrating Groq as an LLM provider in Rig will allow users to take advantage of its efficient processing capabilities.

### Resources

- **API Documentation**: [Groq API Reference](https://console.groq.com/docs/api-reference#chat-create)

**Additional Notes:**

Add vector store support for Sqlite (with sqlite-vec extension).

Motivation
Sqlite is one of the most widely used open source databases and supports vector search via the [sqlite-vec](https://github.com/asg017/sqlite-vec) extension. This makes the database a good integration candidate for Rig.

Proposal
Create a new companion crate in the repository called rig-sqlite.
Implement the VectorStore and VectorStoreIndex traits for the selected Sqlite client.

Note: The integration should be similar to the MongoDB vector store integration (see [rig-mongodb](https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/main/rig-mongodb/src/lib.rs)).

title: feat: Add support for Neo4j vector store

type.name: Feat
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
## Vector Store Integration Request
Neo4j is one of the most popular graph databases which also supports vector indices and semantic search. The database comes in two flavors: a community edition and an enterprise edition (both support semantic search). Both edition can be self hosted using the `neo4j` docker [image](https://hub.docker.com/_/neo4j). The database is also available as a fully managed SaaS via [Aura](https://neo4j.com/product/auradb/). 

### Implementation Checklist
- [ ] Create a new companion crate `rig-neo4j` which contains a client struct for Neo4j to perform semantic search
- [ ] Implement the `VectorStoreIndex` trait for the client
- [ ] Write at least one example to demonstrate how neo4j can be used as a vector store in Rig

### Resources
- [Neo4j vector indices](https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/indexes/semantic-indexes/vector-indexes/)
- [Neo4j docker image](https://hub.docker.com/_/neo4j)
- [Neo4j Rust driver](https://github.com/neo4j-labs/neo4rs)

title: feat: Add support for Gemini completion and embedding models

labels.name: model
labels.description: Relevant to new model providers or implementations

type.name: Feat
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
## Feature Request
Add Gemini as a new model provider for Rig.
 
### Motivation
Gemini is a popular model provider that Rig should support and they have a REST API which should be relatively easy to integrate.

### Proposal
Create a new module `rig::providers::gemini` which implements completion and embedding model clients for Google's Gemini.

Use the existing provider integrations as a guide (see [`rig::providers::openai`](https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/main/rig-core/src/providers/openai.rs) and [`rig::providers::cohere`](https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/main/rig-core/src/providers/cohere.rs)).

You can find a collection of examples using the REST API (implemented in Python) [here](https://github.com/google-gemini/cookbook/tree/main/quickstarts/rest)

title: feat(datastore): add Qdrant data store

type.name: Feat
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
Hey there!

I think adding Qdrant as a possible data store would be quite beneficial for the library as they're fairly well known within the RAG community, so adding it would increase the amount of potential use cases by quite a lot.

I'm happy to implement this for you as it looks like the scope of this is quite clear (just adding a new crate and implementing relevant traits, then adding it to the list whenever you need to release), but wanted to reach out first and make sure it's OK to add.

title: feat: Use finish_reason to check if response messages are tool_calls
body:
- [x] I have looked for existing issues (including closed) about this

## Feature Request
feat: Use finish_reason to check if response messages are tool_calls

### Motivation
https://github.com/0xPlaygrounds/rig/blob/8e6f197f27e0bdbda83d356b7c34001d95a2882e/rig-core/src/providers/openai.rs#L381
Currently we check if `tool_calls` is None, and actually some openai compatible servers like `vllm` just return empty list of `tool_calls` and the [openai document](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/object#chat/object-choices) does not express `tool_calls` as optional, so it's not save to just check it with `None`.

### Proposal
Check the finish_reason field on `tool_calls` or add additional check for empty list

### Alternatives
Maybe other ways exist to handle this
